title: Jack Markell
deleted: More recently, Markell has begun to write lyrics for songs focused on social justice.  The songs can be found on his YouTube page ([https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIsTA7W_mQSH8DqhZg8twQA Music by Jack Markell]).  As of November 2020, he had released two songs: "[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQ5bekwR6Q4 Charlottesville]" about Heather Heyer, who was killed in the protest in 2017; and "[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xjswxS5f4mI Silence of the Good]" which is about Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr's "Letter from Birmingham City Jail", featuring both Eric McFadden and Dr. Clarence B. Jones, advisor to Dr. King.  The music for both songs was written by Ann McNamee.
